intro: Gonolobus heterophyllus, commonly known as the variable leaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant exhibits variability in leaf shape, which is a key feature in its common name. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many other climbing vines. Gonolobus heterophyllus is often found in moist, open habitats and is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value.
